p: The fatty acid composition of the S. mukorossi seed-extracted oil was determined by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) analysis. A representative chromatogram is shown in Figure 2a. The identity of the peak was analyzed using fatty acid standards and the MS database. The percentages of fatty acid esters were obtained by calculating the peak area ratios, which are listed in Table 1. The results show that S. mukorossi seeds contain 5.35% of palmitic acid (C16:0), 0.9% stearic acid (C18:0), 52.46% oleic acid (C18:1), 7.19% linoleic acid (C18:2), 1.61% linolenic acid (C18:3), 6.84% arachidic acid (C20:0), 23.71% eicosenic acid (C20:1), 1.24% bechenic acid, and 0.68% erucic acid (C22:1).
